greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Cototient function of n^2.
comment: Seems to be invertible like n*Phi(n). Compare with A002618, A038040.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n*(n - phi(n)) = n^2 - n*phi(n) = Cototient(n^2) = A051953(A000290(n)).
For p prime, Cototient(p)=1 and a(p)=p.
a(n) = n*cototient(n) = n*A051953(n). - _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 22 2012
program: (Sage) [n*(n - euler_phi(n)) for n in (1..60)] # _G. C. Greubel_, May 18 2019
(GAP) List([1..60], n-> n*(n- Phi(n)) ); # _G. C. Greubel_, May 18 2019
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 18 2000
